['On tap - Suggesting immediate availability like water from a faucet.', 'Abundant - Indicating plentiful supply easily accessible.', 'Easily obtainable - Something can be acquired with little effort.', 'Accessible - Easy to reach or enter; available for use.', 'Obtainable on demand - Available whenever it is requested, as needed.', 'At-hand - Right there in your immediate environment.', 'Handy - Conveniently placed and readily useful.', 'Quickly available - Not kept waiting before obtaining something.', 'Immediate - Without any delay; instant availability.', 'Unfed - Not having eaten recently.', 'Undernourished - Receiving less nourishment than necessary for good health.', 'Malnourished - Suffering from poor nutrition; deficiencies in the diet.', 'Starving - Extreme hunger due to lack of food over an extended period.', "Famished - Feeling a strong desire or need for food, often because one hasn't eaten recently.", 'Hungry stomach - A colloquial term indicating physical discomfort from not having eaten.', 'Inadequately fed - Not receiving enough food to meet dietary requirements.', 'Underfed - Having less food than needed for growth and maintenance.', 'Deprived of food - Being without sufficient nourishment.', 'Nutrient-deficient - Lacking essential nutrients in the diet, leading to health issues.', 'Fasting (when unintended) - Intentionally avoiding any food for religious or health reasons; when not intended, it can lead to hunger.', "Empty belly - A metaphorical expression indicating a lack of food inside one's stomach.", 'Goiter (indirectly related) - A condition caused by iodine deficiency and could be associated with dietary issues leading to hunger or malnutrition.', 'Vitamin deficiency - Lacking essential vitamins which can result from poor eating habits contributing to feelings of hunger.', 'Picky eater (can lead to hunger if not addressed) - Someone who is selective about food, potentially missing out on necessary nutrition and leading to hunger or malnourishment.', 'Food insecurity - The state of being without reliable access to a sufficient quantity of affordable, nutritious food.', 'Underfed child - A young individual not receiving enough food for proper growth and development.', 'Unfulfilled appetite - Having an unmet need or desire for food due to insufficient consumption.', 'Empty pantry - Indicates a lack of stored food, possibly leading to hunger.', 'Lean and gaunt (due to lack of food) - A physical state that results from prolonged inadequate nutrition or starvation.']
